topic_or_construct: decision-making difficulty / response to false feedback
justification: "Response times are highly suitable aggregate measures to capture how participants react to false feedback. If decisions to accept the false feedback are faster than to correct it, this might indicate fast errors…"

topic_or_construct: cognitive effort / attention to salient stimuli
justification: "Experimental work has linked changes in pupil size with increased cognitive effort and to the experience of unexpected outcomes in decision tasks… these features make the pupil signal highly suitable for investigation in relation to the presentation of false feedback."
"During natural viewing, attention is highly yoked to shifts in gaze direction, meaning that by recording eye-movements inferences can be made about what participants are currently attending to."

topic_or_construct: temporal structure of visual attention (fixation sequences)
measured_by: recurrence quantification analysis (DET, LAM) of eye-movement data
justification: "We also performed a recurrence quantification analysis (RQA) of the fixations during the feedback portion of each trial to investigate the temporal structure of fixations."
